title: Understanding the Model
text: We were given that the model is for measuring magnitude of earthquake is $$M=\frac{2}{3} \ln\left(\frac{S}{S_0}\right)$$. In the model, M is the magnitude of the earthquake, $$S_0$$ is the initial seismic moment that led to the occurence of earthquake. S is the seismic moment associated with an earthquake. If we denote the seismic moment of the first earthquake as $$S_1$$. In the context of the question, since the second earthquake has $$750$$ times as much energy as the first, we can interpret its seismic moment as $$750S_1$$.

title: Logarithmic Model
text: Given that the equation for the first earthquake is $$M=\frac{2}{3} \ln\left(\frac{S_1}{S_0}\right)=3.9$$. What is M equals to for the second earthquake? Express in terms of $$S_1$$ and $$S_0$$.

title: Product Rule for Logarithms
text:
The product rule for logarithms can be used to simplify a logarithm of a product by rewriting it as a sum of individual logarithms.
$$\log_{b}\left(M Night)=\log_{b}\left(Might)+\log_{b}\left(Night)for$$ $$b>0$$

Given the logarithm of a product, use the product rule of logarithms to write an equivalent sum of logarithms.

1) Factor the argument completely, expressing each whole number factor as a product of primes.
2) Write the equivalent expression by summing the logarithms of each factor.

title: Apply the Product Rule for Logarithms
text: We can use the product rule to separate the factors, $$750$$ and $$\frac{S_1}{S_0}$$, from within the logarithmic expression of the equation of second earthquake. Write the equivalent expression by summing the logarithms of each factor. What is the new expression?

title: Apply the Product Rule for Logarithms
text: What is the expression after applying product rule to $$\ln\left(M N\right)$$? Express in terms of M and N.

title: Apply the Product Rule for Logarithms
text: What is the expression after applying product rule to $$a \ln\left(M N\right)$$? Express in terms of a, M and N. (In our question, what values / variables does a, M and N refer to?)

title: Simplification
text: What is $$\frac{2}{3} \ln\left(750\right)$$? Round to the nearest hundredth.

title: Substitution
text: We were previously given in the question that $$M=\frac{2}{3} \ln\left(\frac{S_1}{S_0}\right)=3.9$$. We can substitute this as well as the simplification that was previously done into $$M=\frac{2}{3} \ln\left(\frac{S_1}{S_0}\right)+\frac{2}{3} \ln\left(750\right)$$ to find the magnitude of the second earthquake.
